title: Danielle Lloyd makes more Rebekah Vardy story-selling allegations
text:
Danielle Lloyd has waded further into her feud with Rebekah Vardy as the 'War of the WAGs' with Coleen Rooney rages on.

After Coleen, 33, accused Rebekah, 37, of leaking false stories to the press, Danielle, 35, came forth with similar claims leading to a row between the duo on social media.

On Thursday, when a fan criticised Danielle for hitting out at the expectant WAG, she defiantly insisted that Rebekah's pregnancy was no excuse for calming the fight and also alleged that Rebekah had sold stories on one of her friends in the past.

Woah: Danielle Lloyd has waded further into her feud with Rebekah Vardy as the 'War of the WAGs' with Coleen Rooney rages on

Earlier in the day, Danielle made a thinly-veiled dig at Rebekah after weighing in on the Coleen row during an episode of This Morning.

Their spat was sparked after the TV personality, detailed her 'similar run-ins' with the footballer's wife, before Rebekah claimed Danielle was only upset because she didn't 'recruit' one of Jamie's footballer pals for her after her divorce from Jamie O'Hara.

This comes amid reports that many of the WAGs have now distanced themselves from Rebekah and are busy 'scrutinising' past conversations with her, following the fallout from her feud with Coleen.

One of Rebekah's supporters came in Nicola McLean, who has staunchly defended her and claimed it is dangerous for Coleen to put so much pressure on a pregnant woman - something some of Danielle's followers echoed.

Happy days: After Coleen, 33, accused Rebekah, 37, of leaking false stories to the press, Danielle, 35, came forth with similar claims leading to a row between the duo on social media

Take it back! She hit back at a fan, writing: 'She was ok piping up about me before if she wants to give it she needs to take it!'

Danielle however was keen to reiterate that the pregnancy was not a factor.

She wrote: '[Rebekah] was ok piping up about me before if she wants to give it she needs to take it! Someone on her account sold stories on my mate end of pregnant or not! Coleen was pregnant when some of these stories came out'.

Danielle appeared on the morning TV show to express her opinion on the WAG war, and hinted that she has had a similar experience with Rebekah in the past.

However Jamie's wife was quick to retaliate, as she took to Twitter to claim that Danielle's admission was 'utter b******s' and their feud was sparked by her refusal to try and find Danielle a man following her split from Jamie [O'Hara].

Not ok... Appearing on This Morning on Friday, Nicola said: 'Coleen doing this is not okay, as a mother its not okay. She should come out here, until she's proven guilty'

She wrote: 'Danielle Lloyd making false claims on @thismorning that we have had ‘similar run-ins’ is utter b****cks. She is just fuming that I ‘didn’t get Jamie recruiting’ for her like she asked me to...'

Danielle then accused Rebekah of selling 'more' stories to The Sun, a day after Coleen accused her of leaking fake stories about her life.

The Sun posted a story in which a well-timed source claimed Rebekah WAS telling the truth and Danielle did enlist her to help her find love.

Fuming, Danielle, who has previously dated Teddy Sheringham and Jermain Defoe, took to Twitter once again and said Rebekah must be this source of this new story.

Pals: Danielle appeared on the morning TV show to express her opinion on the WAG war, and hinted that she has had a similar experience with Rebekah in the past

In what has become a War of the WAGs, Coleen released an incredible social media statement aimed at Rebekah in which she revealed she set up an elaborate sting on Instagram to 'catch' who was leaking fake stories.

Subsequently Nicola issued a warning to Coleen about stressing out an expectant mother, as she said: 'Coleen doing this is not okay... Something is going to happen to a pregnant woman and a baby!'

Coleen's dramatic revelation enthralled Britain and sparked an angry denial from pregnant Rebekah, who said 'I don't need the money’ and pointed out other people have had access to her Instagram account.

The wife of Jamie Vardy has now given an interview with The Daily Mail, in which she insisted arguing with Coleen is akin to rowing 'with a pigeon'.

The news comes after it was revealed that this week social media stats saw Coleen and Rebekah's row have triple the amount of Twitter mentions (276,822) as Boris Johnson (80,074).

Social Chain Data, who tracked Twitter activity, confirmed that the emotion generated was higher than Brexit, Boris Johnson and Donald Trump combined.
